FuncDef:
The tcp timer syn-timeout command sets the TCP SYN-Wait timer.
The undo tcp timer syn-timeout command restores the default value of the timer. The tcp timer syn-timeout command sets the TCP SYN-Wait timer. The undo tcp timer syn-timeout command restores the default value of the timer. By default, the value of the TCP SYN-Wait timer is 75 seconds.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the value of TCP SYN-Wait timer in seconds.
The value ranges from 2 to 600 seconds.

ExtraInfo: When a SYN packet is sent, TCP enables the SYN-Wait timer. If no response packet is received before SYN-Wait is timeout, the TCP connection is terminated.
